alert.note: Alert for Adair; Allen; Barren; Casey; Edmonson; Green; Hart; Logan; Marion; Metcalfe; Simpson; Taylor; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Logan, southeastern Marion, Simpson, southern Hart, Taylor, western Casey, Adair, southeastern Edmonson, Green, central Allen, Warren, Barren and Metcalfe Counties through 845 PM EDT/745 PM CDT/... At 748 PM EDT/648 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking scattered intense showers and thunderstorms from Russellville to Glasgow to Campellsville moving east northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Hart, Warren, Logan, southeastern Edmonson, Barren, western Casey, Metcalfe, southeastern Marion, Simpson, Taylor, central Allen, Adair and Green Counties, including the following locations... Girkin, Node, Haywood, Bliss, Romine, Settle, Acton, Bramlett, Hatcher and Pascal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT/800 PM CDT/ for south central and central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Allen; Barren; Casey; Edmonson; Green; Hart; Logan; Marion; Metcalfe; Simpson; Taylor; Warren
